title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Barbier. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Barbier J (2025). rtyp: R package generate Typst code. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://y-sunflower.github.io/rtyp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rtyp: An R package to generate Typst code},   author = {Joseph Barbier},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://y-sunflower.github.io/rtyp/}, }

what: An R package to generate Typst code
title: An R package to generate Typst code
text: rtyp, can dynamically generate Typst code. supports: basic Typst functions set rules conversions R types Typst (TRUE -> true, NULL -> none, etc.) Typst units helper functions extremely simple syntax dependencies Check documentation.

title: An R package to generate Typst code
code: library(rtyp)  heading(level = 2, numbering = "1.1", "Hello world") > #heading(level: 2, numbering: "1.1")[Hello world]  text(font = "Libertinus Serif", "I love cookies") > #text(font: "Libertinus Serif")[Hello world]  text(size = pt(12), baseline = em(1.2), overhang = FALSE, "hello") > #text(size: 12pt, baseline: 1.2em, overhang: false)[hello]

title: An R package to generate Typst code
An R package to generate Typst code
text: want write compile typst files R, check {typr} package.

what: Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
title: Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
text: Generates Typst code heading() element. Named arguments included Typst keyword arguments (e.g. level, numbering), unnamed arguments used heading content.

title: Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
text: ... Named unnamed arguments passed Typst heading() function. Named arguments become Typst parameters (e.g. level = 2 → level: 2), unnamed arguments form body inside [...].

title: Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
text: character string containing generated Typst code.

title: Create a Typst Heading Element — heading
code: heading(level = 2, numbering = "1.1", "Hello world") #> [1] "#heading(level: 2, numbering: \"1.1\")[Hello world]" heading("Just text") #> [1] "#heading[Just text]"

what: Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading
title: Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading
text: Generates Typst set rules heading() element. Named arguments included Typst keyword arguments (e.g. level, numbering), unnamed arguments used heading content.

title: Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading
Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading
text: ... Named unnamed arguments passed Typst heading() function. Named arguments become Typst parameters (e.g. level = 2 → level: 2), unnamed arguments form body inside [...].

title: Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading
text: character string containing generated Typst code.

title: Create a Typst set rules for Heading — set_heading

what: Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text
title: Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text
text: Generates Typst set rules text() element. Named arguments included Typst keyword arguments (e.g. level, numbering), unnamed arguments used text content.

title: Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text
Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text
text: ... Named unnamed arguments passed Typst text() function. Named arguments become Typst parameters (e.g. level = 2 → level: 2), unnamed arguments form body inside [...].

title: Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text
text: character string containing generated Typst code.

title: Create a Typst set rules for text — set_text

what: Create a Typst Text Element — text
title: Create a Typst Text Element — text
text: Generates Typst code text() element. Named arguments included Typst keyword arguments (e.g. font), unnamed arguments used text content.

title: Create a Typst Text Element — text
Create a Typst Text Element — text
text: ... Named unnamed arguments passed Typst text() function. Named arguments become Typst parameters (e.g. font = "Libertinus Serif" → font: "Libertinus Serif"), unnamed arguments form body inside [...].

title: Create a Typst Text Element — text
text: character string containing generated Typst code.

title: Create a Typst Text Element — text
code: text(font = "Libertinus Serif", "Hello world") #> [1] "#text(font: \"Libertinus Serif\")[Hello world]" text("Just text") #> [1] "#text[Just text]"

title: Create Typst Unit Values — typst_units
text: functions generate special objects representing units Typst code. can used arguments functions like text() heading() produce properly formatted Typst code.

title: Create Typst Unit Values — typst_units
Create Typst Unit Values — typst_units
text: x Numeric value unit.

title: Create Typst Unit Values — typst_units
text: object class typst_unit associated unit attribute. passed Typst-generating function, converted appropriate unit string (e.g., 12pt, 1.5em, 80%).

title: Create Typst Unit Values — typst_units
code: pt(12)       # Represents 12pt #> [1] 12 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "typst_unit" #> attr(,"unit") #> [1] "pt" em(1.5)      # Represents 1.5em #> [1] 1.5 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "typst_unit" #> attr(,"unit") #> [1] "em" percent(80)  # Represents 80% #> [1] 80 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "typst_unit" #> attr(,"unit") #> [1] "%"  text(size = pt(12), "Hello world") #> [1] "#text(size: 12pt)[Hello world]" text(width = percent(50), font_size = em(1.2), "Hi") #> [1] "#text(width: 50%, font_size: 1.2em)[Hi]"
